data.speaker: User
data.message: Hi, i would like to know which citation style should i use for citing a graph as i was not able to find it in the research guide

data.speaker: User
data.message: Yes, another question would for the green highlighted portion is the description of the figure, so if the graph has a title at the top should i just copy the text when i cite it ?

data.speaker: User
data.message: I am citing from a blog

data.speaker: User
data.message: I just follow the citation from the website ?

data.speaker: User
data.message: That should be all from me

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: Hello, how may I help you?

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: graphs can be treated as figures, so you can follow the format for citing a figure in APA in this case

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: "Figures" generally refer to graphs and images

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: Is there anything else I can assist?

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: the green part should your summary of what the graph is about i.e. how is it relevant to your current argument. The title of the graph is usually put on the blue section. Perhaps you can look at this libguide for more examples:https://aut.ac.nz.libguides.com/APA7th/figures

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: if you're citing this graph from a journal article, you can look at the second example in the above link :)

data.speaker: Help Desk
data.message: in that case I think you can treat the blog as a website and follow the outline there
